article.headline: Toledo 77, Ball State 67
article.story: TOLEDO, Ohio (AP) -- Keith Triplett had 16 points and Justin Ingram scored 11 of his 13 points in the second half to help Toledo beat Ball State 77-67 on Wednesday. Keonta Howell added 14 points off the bench for the Rockets (6-7, 2-2 Mid-American), who held the Cardinals to just 34.5 percent shooting from the field. Terrance Chapman scored 18 points and Julien Mills had 15 for Ball State (7-5, 2-2), which committed 20 turnovers. Peyton Stovall had 13 points and seven rebounds, but also had eight of the turnovers. Chapman, Mills and Stovall all reached double figures in the first half as Ball State led 35-32 at halftime. The Cardinals made 16 of 20 free throws in the opening half. Toledo rallied to take a 58-56 lead, then went on a 10-2 run. Triplett had four points and Sammy Villegas hit two 3-pointers during the spurt. Villegas finished with 12 points for the Rockets, who went 23-for-31 from the free-throw line. Dennis Trammell finished with 12 points for the Cardinals, who only went 5-of-12 from the line in the second half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
